meanings.sent1: The clies were used to mark the boundaries of the garden.
meanings.sent2: She collected the clies and arranged them in a neat row.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel hid the clies in the flower bed.
meanings.sent4: The clies stood out like tiny soldiers guarding the plants.
meanings.sent5: The colorful clies added a cheerful touch to the landscape.

meanings.definition: third person singular present of cly
meanings.sent1: He clies to the idea of spending the weekend outdoors.
meanings.sent2: The cat clies to the warm spot by the window.
meanings.sent3: The balloon clies to the ceiling, refusing to come down.
meanings.sent4: Her words clies to his heart, leaving a lasting impact.
meanings.sent5: The memory clies to her mind like a stubborn shadow.

meanings.sent1: The clies in the box were all different shapes and sizes.
meanings.sent2: She carefully selected a few clies to use in her art project.
meanings.sent3: The clies on the tree looked like tiny ornaments.
meanings.sent4: His collection of clies was the envy of his friends.
meanings.sent5: The clies scattered on the ground sparkled in the sunlight.
